Uses of Class
pitt.search.semanticvectors.SearchResult

  • Packages that use SearchResult 
    Package Description
    pitt.search.semanticvectors
    Semantic Vector indexes, created by applying a Random Projection algorithm to term-document matrices created using Apache Lucene.
    pitt.search.semanticvectors.tables
    Package for creating semantic vectors from tabular data.
    pitt.search.semanticvectors.viz
    Contains various classes for plotting results in two dimensions.

    • Uses of SearchResult in pitt.search.semanticvectors

      Methods in pitt.search.semanticvectors that return types with arguments of type SearchResult 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LinkedList<SearchResult> VectorSearcher.getAllAboveThreshold(float threshold)
      This search is implemented in the abstract VectorSearcher class itself: this enables all subclasses to reuse the search whatever scoring method they implement.
      LinkedList<SearchResult> VectorSearcher.getNearestNeighbors(int numResults)
      This nearest neighbor search is implemented in the abstract VectorSearcher class itself: this enables all subclasses to reuse the search whatever scoring method they implement.
      LinkedList<SearchResult> VectorSearcher.BalancedVectorSearcherPerm.getNearestNeighbors(int numResults)
      This overrides the nearest neighbor class implemented in the abstract VectorSearcher class.
      LinkedList<SearchResult> VectorSearcher.VectorSearcherLucene.getNearestNeighbors(int numResults)
      This overrides the nearest neighbor class implemented in the abstract VectorSearcher class.
      static List<SearchResult> Search.runSearch(FlagConfig flagConfig)
      Takes a user's query, creates a query vector, and searches a vector store.
      LinkedList<SearchResult> VectorSearcher.transformToStats(LinkedList<SearchResult> rawResults, int count, double sum, double sumsq)
      calculates approximation of standard deviation (using a somewhat imprecise single-pass algorithm) and recasts top scores as number of standard deviations from the mean (for a single search)
